website_summaries.verdict: The Intel Core i7-4770K, based on Intel's Haswell microarchitecture, is a great chip if you need an upgrade, but performance gains are modest.
pros: Intel's latest architecture adds new features
cons: Draws slightly more power than previous designs

customer_reviews.title: great value for the energy efficiency performance
customer_reviews.text: + CPU performance similar to high segment, great value for the energy efficiency performance, even faster hardware video converter (QuickSync), the new HD 4600 integrated graphics with good performance, the process of the 22-nm technology, the new multimedia instructions, a higher performance than the previous generation with the same taktowaniach , unlocked multiplier and the possibility of using BCLK overclocking _ Stand forces the new motherboard, the maximum TDP higher than the previous generation, the relatively high price
customer_reviews.author: djnov

customer_reviews.title: Great but HOT
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic CPU however does run really hot without overclocking on an AIO CPU liquid cooler (Enermax Liqtech 120X). Up to 85C with Prime95 out of the box. Pros Fast Reliable Does the job quickly Cons HOT Expensive (now the 4970K is out at the same price) Not a good overclocker because of heat issues without de-lidding.
customer_reviews.author: JoyboyP

customer_reviews.title: fantastic upgrade
customer_reviews.text: upgraded from a AMD phenom x6 1055T. excuse the pun but the difference is phenomenal. This is my first intel build and i am more than satisfied with the performance this cpu offers. my PC is geared towards gaming and this CPU paired with my 7950 provides excellent frame rates in all my games on max settings. tried my hand at overclocking it and reached a somewhat average stable 4.5Ghz at 1.25V. could have pushed it higher but eventually backed it off back to stock settings as it really wasn't needed (for gaming at least). maybe in a year or two ill crank up the OC again when games need a bit more juice. highly recommended from me :)
customer_reviews.author: Michael Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: I run this chip on a MSI z87 G45 gaming motherboard, with a couple of SSD's and a EVGA gtx 780ti graphics card. Can't beat the performance both in-game and generally within the Windows 7 environment. Fast, responsive and deals with almost anything i can throw at it. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: S_by_SW

customer_reviews.title: super!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great processor and with the right components makes a solid base for a gaming rig. Capable of running arma 3 on ultra for most of the settings with a good gpu and ram. Coupled with windows 10 preview it ran amazingly well so much so I was shocked, good price and should last a couple of years.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased, it is a great product for the value
customer_reviews.text: * * I am very pleased, i can't ask for more, it is a great product for the value. * *
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Blancas Bansells

customer_reviews.title: Woosh
customer_reviews.text: Woosh..... This thing flies - just right for intensive crunching activities such as video editing (though not as much of a benefit over an i5 for gaming so I hear) Woosh could also be the sound of the large amount of cash being wrenched from your wallet :( Luckily, I paid by credit card so I didn't hear a thing.
customer_reviews.author: C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this CPU to fit in a new desktop PC I was building. Installation and setup was very easy. I have over-clocked this CPU with no problems except the extra heat generated. I have replaced the fan supplied by Intel with a much more efficient fan and have had no over-heating issues. I would recommend getting a more efficient fan, even if you are not going to over-clock this CPU as it still gets very hot under demanding tasks. Overall I am very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Bourne

customer_reviews.title: Great for gaming
customer_reviews.text: Extremely fast Cpu. Great for gaming, video editing and all demanding tasks. 5 stars for performance. 3 stars for Intel/Amazon as I originally got sent the wrong CPU which then delayed some work. Props to Amazon for sorting it out in a timely fashion.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Good and fine
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised and came quickly in the post. A bit of a pain using UPS since I was out and I had to collect the package from a "convenient" drop-off point that was miles away and did not have the choice of redelivery. However, other than that it is all good
customer_reviews.author: Black

customer_reviews.title: Just brutal!
customer_reviews.text: What can you say? Is fast, powerful and is the best 4th generation Intel processor for socket 1150. Tends to get a bit hot so you better have a good cooling solution because with the stock cooler you can't overclock this beast much. If you're not into overclocking than it's ok. Highly recommended if you can afford it!
customer_reviews.author: MarcolinoPT

customer_reviews.title: This is a great processor. It handles the latest games barely working ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great processor. It handles the latest games barely working up a sweat and it does quite complex spreadsheet calculations in about half the time of my work PC. I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: JamieF

customer_reviews.title: Love building I7 computers theyu are so straight forward and ...
customer_reviews.text: Love building I7 computers theyu are so straight forward and bullet proof you can over clock it if you want but it will last longer run cooler and give you less trouble if you don't.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Leese

customer_reviews.title: very fast...
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to the i7, from an old AMD chip, and wow, the difference. It's lightning fast when combined with an SSD. Dont use the stock cooler, get something with more cooling power, and you'll have a fast computer.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: heat is good with my H100I
customer_reviews.text: Fast, powerful. All a CPU needs to be, heat is good with my H100I; sitting at ~29 degrees browsing the web with a lot of tabs, music and eclipse open. The integrated gfx also work well an can run games like far cry 3 on low at a solid 30 FPS.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: Just built a high-spec machine after my laptop died on me... the difference in performance is truly jaw-dropping, even after coming from a laptop i7-3630qm. Using an ASUS VI Hero mobo, with a corsair h100i cpu cooler (not stock), and am getting very low, consistent temperatures without overclock; have yet to try overclock since it has handled everything fine at stock frequency so far. Not cheap, but definitely worth considering.
customer_reviews.author: Jasper

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Processor
customer_reviews.text: I got this processor as part of my new gaming rig and plugged it into an Asus Sabertooth Z87 motherboard. Easy installation, no issues there. I haven't overclocked it yet but honestly I don't feel the need, it handles everything I throw at it with ease. Not the cheapest CPU out there (though I note it has come down in price since I bought it) but I'd argue it's more than worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ian K

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU, but overclocking on Haswell chips is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU, but overclocking on Haswell chips is a bit unreliable. Could only push it to 4.4Ghz on 2 cores and 4.3Ghz on 4 cores at 1.25 volts. Your mileage may vary. Otherwise, very powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Mindaugas Celkys

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I recently upgraded my 2010 i7 to this and wow it made a huge difference. The processes are faster games run without any hitches and overall system just feels slick. Highly recommended 9/10
customer_reviews.author: syphern

customer_reviews.title: Maybe next time Games Consoles.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bit of kit, currently the brains behind my gaming rig putting the Xbox One and PS4 to shame.
customer_reviews.author: comer74

customer_reviews.title: love this alot
customer_reviews.text: fast and efficient and runs games well i tell ya,i will be adding a liquid cooler soon to keep temps beneath 45-50c when gaming,defiantly worth buying if your making a new build or coming up in the world from a crappy over used dual core duo like i did,pricey but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Fast and furious
customer_reviews.text: I can't really add much to the many positive comments about this CPU. It overclocks with little fuss and with a H60 cooler runs in the mid 30's at 4.30GHZ. What is not to like?
customer_reviews.author: Hugh

customer_reviews.title: Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't quite overclock as far as I would liked. Stable at 4.2Ghz. You can never have enough speed! Nice product.
customer_reviews.author: Toehoke

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: z87 board ..water cooled and overclocked i'm well happy with this....moved up from 3.0 core2duo and the difference is amazing...i'm well pleased
customer_reviews.author: just another surfer

customer_reviews.title: Fast and reliable!!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best cpus on the market for the price that I paid. I considered an i5 but because I was building a gaming rig, I decided to pay the bit extra and get this beast of a processor! Had it for the last few weeks and the difference I've noticed is immense! My laptop in comparison is sooo slow! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ronan

customer_reviews.title: Fast Processor
customer_reviews.text: This processor performs very well. However, the inbuilt graphics card is an annoying feature, as I don't know how to use both the GTX 660Ti Geforce 2GB graphics card and the inbuilt one on the CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Dutra

customer_reviews.title: Beast
customer_reviews.text: Very good CPU, thoroughly recommend, definately consider if looking to edit videos, VFX work etc. I'd say keep the cost down and get a better graphics card for gaming, like an i5
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D. R. Fielding

customer_reviews.title: good for the price
customer_reviews.text: this works very well and was packaged correctly. still use daily and have not seen performance drops as per.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Arnold

customer_reviews.title: Powerful yet inexpensive CPU
customer_reviews.text: I done a fair bit of research on CPUs before purchasing the 4770K & I wasn't disappointed. Great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Gooey

customer_reviews.title: A Good BUY
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 1150 CPU as part of my first computer build. Although I have no intention of overclocking I bought the K model. However you should never say never. Pleased
customer_reviews.author: Grandad47

customer_reviews.title: Nice chip and super fast in my PC
customer_reviews.text: Bought for building my own PC. Nice chip and super fast in my PC. Has been running fine so far, easy to understand instructions and easy to fit.
customer_reviews.author: J O

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU for what you're paying for
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU for what you're paying for, overclocks to 4.2Ghz very easily on high end water and air coolers, impressed! 5 Stars!
customer_reviews.author: Dans Tech

customer_reviews.title: Speeeed
customer_reviews.text: Blisteringly fast, even at stock. Coupled it with a MSI Z87-G45 motherboard and Cooler Master Hyper 212 eve heatsink. Cant even hear it in idle. Amazing
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P. J. Greenaway

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of oomph!
customer_reviews.text: Fast and cool. I'm not an overclocker so I cannot comment on that much. Does what it says on the tin.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. D. K. Maunders

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new CPU for my new custom built. It was really good but sadly the stock fan was a massive headache as i had some issues with the aftermarket fan but over all just what i needed.
customer_reviews.author: ummar malik

customer_reviews.title: Intel Core i7 4770K Quad Core Retail CPU
customer_reviews.text: super fast! super easy to overclock and you can show all your friends your intel core i7 iniside sticker ;)
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Video Editing
customer_reviews.text: Put this little gem into a PC i am using to do a lot of video editing in, and it flies! My render time has less than halved from my 3rd gen i7 and the general workflow feels so much smoother! Put with a standard water cooler and overclocked the temps are still not exceeding 75 Degrees! Fantastic little processor!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Simon J. Adshead

customer_reviews.title: a cracker
customer_reviews.text: I bought this processor for my new gaming rig, although games don't use multi-threading. The performance boost from this chip is amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Jeffus

customer_reviews.title: Future proof
customer_reviews.text: Can handle anything i threw at it. Great perfomance in modern games also. This cpu will last me 5-6 years without bottlenecking my system
customer_reviews.author: Aristos Sergiou

customer_reviews.title: i7
customer_reviews.text: With this chip and 16 gb of ram I can now edit with After Effects CS6 and get the results I have been waiting for, for years.
customer_reviews.author: Steve W

customer_reviews.title: It does the job...
customer_reviews.text: Quick and responsive. My rig runs quick and smooth under load. Not sure what else, if anything, there is to say.
customer_reviews.author: P EWENS

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing, coming from a cheap, old amd cpu to this was the happiest moment in my computer life EXTREMELY fast
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Id still go back and get an I5 because I ...
customer_reviews.text: Id still go back and get an I5 because I really don't use this that much but it does help in EU4. Then again the bragging rights might just be worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Luc

customer_reviews.title: Great processor recommend it to anyone i had intel Pentium ...
customer_reviews.text: Great processor recommend it to anyone i had intel Pentium and this is a lot faster also 22 and 36 degrees
customer_reviews.author: Nico

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this is a beast, its still kicking ass now in my latest gaming rig
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line gaming CPU!
customer_reviews.text: So far it has served me well. It gives brilliant performance and is a very good quality processor. Definitely recommended to gamer's who want the best.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Giles

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works good - Delivery fast - All up and running - no probs!
customer_reviews.author: Angel with an A

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, well packaged and performing as it should - like an animal.
customer_reviews.author: David Nevin

customer_reviews.title: A good Chip
customer_reviews.text: Mine reached 4.5GHZ at 1.26V V-core at 76C MAX load, A good Chip
customer_reviews.author: Moh-Tec-Reviews

customer_reviews.title: very happy i used a h100i corsair water cooler my first ...
customer_reviews.text: very happy i used a h100i corsair water cooler my first time power up ticked over in normal mode at 3.9 Ghz Phew! gimme a joystick somebody NOW!
customer_reviews.author: baggy

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: very good, although the fan that comes with it is not that good
customer_reviews.author: Mr Eko

customer_reviews.title: great for rendering
customer_reviews.text: i bought this along with the msi z87 g45 motherboard.. i mainly use it for rendering and 3D stuff,its fast, great
customer_reviews.author: Mangena

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly Reliable Performance
customer_reviews.text: When I built my PC I was upgrading from a middle-of-the-range laptop. The difference in performance is gargantuan, and there has been no program or game to date that's come close to testing this amazing chip at stock clocks.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Bellamy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Does as it should although I'm not to happy about delivery
customer_reviews.author: sonya buckley

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was good, keeping the precious CPU safe and sound. No problems with the CPU it's self, works great. Over clocked it to 4.5 Ghz and works brilliant at a steady temperature. 10/10
customer_reviews.author: lewis

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: Gotta be the best CPU i have ever had and iv had alot.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: excellent CPU
customer_reviews.text: great CPU but buy the i7 4790k to get more bang for your buck
customer_reviews.author: owen sutherland

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says on the tin. Absolutely no problems over clocking it, although it performs perfectly well at stock speed.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Ward

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: First gaming build. Got this to go with MSI Z87-GD65-GAMING ATX Motherboard, well happy, no problems, goes like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: anthony west

customer_reviews.title: what can i say
customer_reviews.text: pound for pound best chip on the market without paying an arm and a leg for it would recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Fast little processor
customer_reviews.text: As mentioned this is a fast little processor that can be adapted for overclocking. Just installed it within my new system and all seems good.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Andrew Moffat

customer_reviews.title: Good service
customer_reviews.text: Very good quick processor , fitted easy enough onto motherboard so far so good , seems to handle what I've thrown at so far
customer_reviews.author: Mr H.

customer_reviews.title: Spec says it all!
customer_reviews.text: Versatile fast performer. It's new(!) so untested long term but, to date it's stable, fluid and does what it claims! Read the spec!
customer_reviews.author: rnoldlane

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Can't really add to what has been said by others. Blazingly fast. OCing can add another 15 - 20% performance without overheating issues using standard cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Barry

customer_reviews.title: nice if you have the money
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, nice if you have the money, If not, an i5 will do you fine!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. S. Appleton

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: using it about 3 months and no probs ,everything is fine i like it ,recomended for others and its cheap
customer_reviews.author: Egidijus

customer_reviews.title: Amazing CPU!!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this from an old Core 2 Quad Q9550. When that was coued with a GTX660 ti it could run everything, albeit in 720p on lowest settings. Battlefield 3, on low at 720p got me around 30-40 FPS. After I upgraded to this, at 1080p in high I got 100+ FPS, or mid to high 50s on ultra. Coupled with an Asus Z87-Pro motherboard, this processor automatically overclocks itself to 4.1GHz to 4.3GHz. It truely is a monster for performance. The only suggestion I have is that you buy your own beatsink and thermal paste. With a Hyper 212 Plus and Arctic Silver 5, this thing rarely reaches 50°C. For the price, this is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Duane Miles

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU if a little expensive
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the heat form this Haswell chip but with good CPU cooling (which you should have if your going to spend £200+ on a CPU) there isn't a problem unless you overclock the chip stupidly then its your own fault.
customer_reviews.author: GiraffeBurger

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: I have recently installed this processor on my ASUS Z87-PRO. I have left in 'normal' mode for the time being to assess its performance and I am amazed how it handles all the tasks I set it. I shall over-clock it using the MOBO's built in suite as soon as I have completed the basic assessment
customer_reviews.author: Chilli Prawn

customer_reviews.title: 4th Generation
customer_reviews.text: I have the 3rd & 4th Generation 3770k models and would easily buy another. Don't use the included fan though and purchase something more superior
customer_reviews.author: Unknown

customer_reviews.title: fast and reliable
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for few weeks now. very fast and reliable, would recoment to anyone who is going to upgrade.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Simple installation, perfect fit. Runs like a charm and highly tuneable. Out of box speed is excellent base to build from.
customer_reviews.author: Aroth63

customer_reviews.title: Amazing CPU
customer_reviews.text: I chose this CPU for my first costume build, and it runs beautifuly and quite cold. I really can't complain, though I can't talk about the integrated graphics as I'm using a dedicated GPU.
customer_reviews.author: Fernando Eimbcke

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable-Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Faster and more powerful then anything I have ever seen-Get one today.Only thing is you will want a high performance cooler!
customer_reviews.author: john ryan

customer_reviews.title: Cooool...
customer_reviews.text: This chip in a Sabertooth Z87 is brilliant! Although seriously overpowered for gaming and even more so when overclocked to 4.5Gig, it will eat any task I give it, at any time, and beg for more. Running Minecraft and the terrible mess that is BF3, and running a security scan, whilst rendering video, it still only hits 45 C with a H100i cooler. I love it. :) Just need more screens and a couple of Graphics cards now......
customer_reviews.author: Freeflyfool

customer_reviews.title: perfect Core I7 4770K
customer_reviews.text: perfect package . delivery and working very well . i am so happy to paid more and bought this CPU. .BUT you must buy a good fan for it because this cpu is expensive and it worth it to have a good fan on it
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: great performance and built in graphics too.
customer_reviews.text: ok its pricey but works flawlessly and is fast plus the graphics are perfectly good for my use as a silent PC. Graphics are supposed to be good enough for low res games but I just use it to run Reaper DAW software.
customer_reviews.author: FlipM

customer_reviews.title: Very speedy processor
customer_reviews.text: I bought this processor for my new gaming/workstation PC as I new intel processors have a great reputation and the 4770k is one of the best ones around at the moment. I managed to overclock mine to a healthy 4.6Ghz which i was very pleased with. Although this is not one of the cheapest processors around I would say it is definately worth the money for someone who needs to run intensive programmes on a daily basis. If you are purely building a gaming pc I would recommend an i5 over this as you will get almost identical performance for £100 less.
customer_reviews.author: JiriK60

customer_reviews.title: Very cool chip - but K chips not for VMWARE !!!
customer_reviews.text: Building a new VMWare rig I did the usual research and choose the 4770 family - then choose the mother board (GA-Z87-HD3) and its mind boggling BIOS. Takes a while to get through - more on that in its review! However , sadly the K chips are all missing a vital component for Virtualisation - the "Direct IO (VT-d)" feature. So now I need to get a non K chip, like the i7-4770. 4770K gets lots of good reviews - my 2hours of Windows 7 showed it to be very very quick.
customer_reviews.author: CymonZ

customer_reviews.title: Top of the range CPU.
customer_reviews.text: Not cheap, but I wanted a powerful CPU for my new 64bit PC. It's a shame that Intel still includes a fan PC cooler, which one normally throws away. The CPU has been fitted in an ASUS Z87-PRO mother board. Unfortunately like many others, the supplied ASUS AI Suite 3 overclocking software crashes on my system, so I cannot try overclocking yet. I use my new PC for photo/video editing and not gaming.
customer_reviews.author: Southcoaster

customer_reviews.title: Very good CPU
customer_reviews.text: In this Price range this product stands out. I was initially planning on buying a 2011 motherboard and CPU but this build turned out to be cheaper and has better performance. Very happy, bought this with the Asus Rampage VI Hero.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Perfect processor
customer_reviews.text: The New generation Intel i7 4770K is providing a very stable overclocking. I used it with Gigabyte New Generation 8 serious motherboard Z87X OC FORCE. Excellent results. Temperature never exceeded 60 Degree C.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Hishmat Atytalla

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: PC Overclocked to 4.5ghz using a Corsair H100 cooler, Gigabyte GA-Z87X-OC motherboard, DDR3 2400mhz ram, Radeon 7990 graphics card. Stellar performance.
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for me.
customer_reviews.text: If my old machine had not died I would likely have waited for the next iteration of the Intel CPU. Sadly that was not to be so chose the 4770K. Its only shortcoming is it's not great for overclocking compared to earlier Intel chips. That said it is more than powerful enough for me right now and has enough potential to keep me going for 2 or 4 years, which fits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. John Allison

customer_reviews.title: Fast
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a first gen i7 and it makes an incredible difference, haven't tried overclocking yet but probably will in the future which is why I went for the K version, a little worried about heat complaints some people have had with the Haswell cpu's but that's just when ocing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Casal

customer_reviews.title: VERY POWERFULL
customer_reviews.text: Again INTEL is the way forward. Powerful, stable, VERY easy to overclock and so much better than 8cores AMD !
customer_reviews.author: Daz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Its delivery was extremely quick and it arrived fully intact. After installing and updating i tested it out by playing some games that i used to get some major drop in frames and i wasnt dissapointed there either. All in all its been a purchase well worth the money (especially with the amount that i game too)
customer_reviews.author: Mathew

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice
customer_reviews.text: I have this cpu installed on an Asus Z87 Deluxe Motherboard (see my review of that!) and as far as I can tell this CPU meets all my requirements for speed and state of the art features. My first venture into the world of self-built PC's and I am extremely pleased with the performance of all the items purchased from Amazon UK. (Except the Motherboard!)
customer_reviews.author: Bill Robinson

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted speedy, so I paid for it. Never tried anything other than Intel, so it's what I went for, and Haswell (4th Gen) was cheaper than Ivy Bridge (3rd Gen) at the time of purchase, and allowed me to get a better motherboard due to the 1150 socket.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: a fantastic processor
customer_reviews.text: I have never been lucky enough to use something as powerful as this, can't wait to see how powerful it is when i am editing an hour long video
customer_reviews.author: wiill

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: i built first time gaming pc and i choose this CPU and it`s very very good CPU.. Consider: I rate this CPU in 5 stars because it`s very good
customer_reviews.author: Dinars

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I choose this CPU because each one core is quicker than others CPU offer, the best 4 core CPU for calculations. For many years I used AMD but last generation FX dissapoint me.
customer_reviews.author: Cedr77

customer_reviews.title: Its ok
customer_reviews.text: its a ok processor everything works fine for now but i did not really get to much of a difference from my previous i7 3770k
customer_reviews.author: Liam damen

customer_reviews.title: Weird Temperature problems
customer_reviews.text: I dont know how i feel about this particular cpu. I am having lot of problems with temperature errors and computer freezing. Maybe the stock fan is useless, maybe i received a defective product, who knows, performance is good.
customer_reviews.author: A.M

customer_reviews.title: okey
customer_reviews.text: Intel Core i7 4770K Quad Core Retail CPU (Socket 1150, 3.50GHz, 8MB, Haswell, 84W, Intel Graphics, BX80646I74770K, 4th Generation Intel Core, Turbo Boost Technology 2.0)
customer_reviews.author: lina

customer_reviews.title: Stable High Speed Processor
customer_reviews.text: Installed on a Gigabyte GA-Z87X-UD4H motherboard provides 8 cores of 3.4G. Does require liquid cooling in the current heat wave and even with a Corsair twin fan radiator runs one core at 60°C! The others are usually about 52-54°C which is acceptable in a local room temperature of 37-38°C! Am about to try a better Conductive paste when it arrives from the US. My pc runs 24 hours non stop every day on essential work and has to be both fast and reliable, the 4700K achieves the speed I require.
customer_reviews.author: Brian H

customer_reviews.title: haswell cpu
customer_reviews.text: this has replaced an intel 2600k and it is noticably faster in the real world of games and applications not to be put off by the average benchmark readings most reviewers give - I have a high spec machine and this cpu does it justice can only give it 4 stars because (in my opinion) it is too expensive - but that's Intel! I have to say it is much faster than an equivelent AMD, so the choice is yours - pay the extra get the extra performance or pay less and get average performance.

product_meta.title: Intel Core i7 4770K Quad Core Retail CPU (Socket 1150, 3.50GHz, 8MB, Haswell, 84W, Intel Graphics, BX80646I74770K, 4th Generation Intel Core, Turbo Boost Technology 2.0)
product_meta.description:
Style Name:Version with fan

Intel's 4th gen processor codename: Haswell offers superior performance over the previous generation Ivybridge by up to 10% clock for clock. This astounding performance boost results in performance improvements in multi-tasking, encoding, gaming and multithreaded applications. Intel's 4th generation processor has improved PCI-Lane 3.0 bandwidth which helps further boost performance of latest generation 3 graphics cards for the ultimate gaming experience.

For overclocking enthusiasts, Intel's 4th gen CPU has improved memory overclocking support, with up to and beyond 3000MHz possible with the very best memory kits. Memory bandwidth is critically important to Haswell compared to previous generations. High frequency memory performance significantly improves encoding, gaming and benchmarking tasks.

The biggest leap in Intel's Haswell processor is the on-board graphics which is now up to 2.6x faster than previous HD4000 found in the Ivybridge CPU. What this means is these latest processors can actually play the latest games in HD with low/medium settings applied. Of course if you want to experience True HD gaming at maximum details then a dedicated graphics card is still a must.

There are two words in your vocabulary that should never meet—Game and Over. You love playing, and you love winning, so you demand unmatched performance, the ability to customise your rig, and features that put you in control of the action. With Intel technology, you step into a heart-pounding experience. Pick up your weapon, challenge your friends, and experience gaming at its best—because the only thing more amazing than Intel technology is what you’ll do with it.

As a creative force and a professional, you must continually balance your vision with the deadlines of the real world. Intel technology helps you keep up with your creativity with unmatched and customisable performance, and feature’s that give you full control to optimise your workflow and maximise your productivity. So keep imagining, keep creating, and take your inspiration to the limit—because the only thing more amazing than Intel technology is what you’ll do with it.
